description: Consolidated error detection framework for Stanford Law Review R1 cite checking

bluebook_errors.description: Citation to authorities supporting entire sentence should appear at end of sentence
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The court held that strict scrutiny applies. 1 This standard
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court held that strict scrutiny applies.1 This standard

bluebook_errors.description: Footnote call number for partial sentence support should appear after the specific clause
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The defendant's motion to suppress. 2 The prosecution
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The defendant's motion to suppress2 The prosecution

bluebook_errors.description: Footnote call should come AFTER punctuation, with exception of dash or colon
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The rule applies — 1 specifically in cases
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The rule applies1 — specifically in cases

bluebook_errors.description: Citation sentence in footnote must start with capital letter
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: (citation omitted). see Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999).
bluebook_errors.correct_example: (citation omitted). See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999).

bluebook_errors.description: Citation sentence in footnote must end with period
Citation clause supporting only part of sentence must be set off by commas
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The doctrine was rejected See id. at 234 and later revised
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The doctrine was rejected, See id. at 234, and later revised

bluebook_errors.description: Use 'See' when authority supports but does not clearly state proposition
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See only the holding in Smith v. Jones
bluebook_errors.correct_example: E.g., the holding in Smith v. Jones

bluebook_errors.description: 'E.g.' must be accompanied by other authorities of same type
bluebook_errors.correct_example: E.g., Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); Williams v. Board, 234 F.3d 567 (2000).

bluebook_errors.description: 'Accord' should cite single authority that states same proposition
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Accord Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); See also Williams
bluebook_errors.correct_example: Accord, Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999). See also Williams

bluebook_errors.description: Signal must be followed by correct punctuation (period, comma, or no space)
'Compare' signal must be paired with 'with' clause
bluebook_errors.correct_example: Compare Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999), with Williams v. Board, 234 F.3d 567 (2000)

bluebook_errors.description: Use 'But see' for direct contradiction, 'But cf.' requires explanation
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: But cf. the approach in Jones
bluebook_errors.correct_example: But cf. the approach in Jones (suggesting different interpretation)

bluebook_errors.description: 'See generally' provides helpful background, not direct support
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See generally, the holding in Smith v. Jones
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See the holding in Smith v. Jones

bluebook_errors.description: When signal used as verb in footnote text, should NOT be italicized
Signals must appear in order: E.g./Accord/See/See also/Cf, Compare/with, But see/But cf, See generally
Same-type signals must be strung together and separated by semicolons
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example:
See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999).
Cf. Williams v. Board, 234 F.3d 567 (2000).
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); cf. Williams v. Board, 234 F.3d 567 (2000).

bluebook_errors.description: Different signal types must be in separate citation sentences
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999), but see Williams
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999). But see Williams v. Board, 234 F.3d 567 (2000).

bluebook_errors.description: Authorities within signal must be separated by semicolons only
Authorities should be ordered by descending importance/weight when same type
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Board v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); Smith v. Williams, 234 U.S. 567 (1999).
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Williams, 234 U.S. 567 (1999); Board v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999).

bluebook_errors.description: Parenthetical should explain relevance of authority to proposition
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999) (discussing strict scrutiny).

bluebook_errors.description: Explanatory parenthetical should begin with lowercase letter unless proper noun
Short quotes in parenthetical must follow rule 1.5(a)(i)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: ("The rule applies to all jurisdictions that have adopted the strict scrutiny test")

bluebook_errors.description: Multiple authorities in explanatory parenthetical must be separated by semicolons
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: (citing Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999), and Williams v. Brown, 234 F.3d 567 (2000))
bluebook_errors.correct_example: (citing Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); Williams v. Brown, 234 F.3d 567 (2000))

bluebook_errors.description: Explanatory parenthetical should not start with quotation mark
Related authority should use explanatory phrase, not parenthetical per table T8
Case names in citations must be italicized
Procedural phrases like 'In re' must be italicized with case name
Book titles in citations must be italicized
Periodical titles in citations must be italicized
Court document titles in text should be in roman, not italics
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The Plaintiff's Motion was filed yesterday.

bluebook_errors.description: Introductory signals should be in regular roman, not italics
Institutional author names in citations should be in SMALL CAPS
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Federal Reserve Board, Policy Statement (2020).
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD, Policy Statement (2020).

bluebook_errors.description: Titles of regulations in code should be in SMALL CAPS
Case names in main text must be italicized
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: In Smith v. Jones, the court held...
bluebook_errors.correct_example: In *Smith v. Jones*, the court held...

bluebook_errors.description: Titles of publications should be italicized in text
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See the discussion in the book Civil Rights Handbook.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See the discussion in the book *Civil Rights Handbook*.

bluebook_errors.description: Procedural phrase 'In re' must be italicized in text
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: In re Smith's Estate was decided.

bluebook_errors.description: Words italicized for emphasis should be used sparingly
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: This is *particularly* important and *must* be followed.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: This is particularly important and must be followed.

bluebook_errors.description: Multi-volume works must indicate volume number before page
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Treatise on Administrative Law, 456 F.3d 123 (1999).
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See 2 Treatise on Administrative Law 456 F.3d 123 (1999).

bluebook_errors.description: Supplements and pocket parts should be indicated in citation
When citing to specific page, must provide pinpoint page number
Footnote references should use 'n.' followed by number (e.g., 'at 15 n.4')
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See id. at 234 fn. 5 for discussion.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See id. at 234 n. 5 for discussion.

bluebook_errors.description: Endnote references should use proper abbreviation
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See the point made in endnote 7.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See the point made in n. 7.

bluebook_errors.description: Tables and charts without page numbers need descriptive identifier
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 tbl. (1999).

bluebook_errors.description: Citations to sections must use § symbol
Multiple sequential sections must use §§ (double symbol)
Non-consecutive sections should be separated by commas, not 'and'
Section symbol should not have period after number
Citations to paragraphs should use ¶ symbol
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See the provision at para. 5 of the document.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See the provision at ¶ 5 of the document.

bluebook_errors.description: When citing appendix, must clearly identify it
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456, app. (1999).

bluebook_errors.description: Preface, foreword, introduction must be clearly identified
Supra and infra should be italicized in cross-references
Cross-references should include pinpoint page or section
Should not use 'hereinafter' for internal cross-references
Id. can only be used when preceding citation contains single authority
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); Williams v. Brown, 234 F.3d 567 (2000). Id.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999); Williams v. Brown, 234 F.3d 567 (2000). Williams v. Brown, 234 F.3d 567 (2000).

bluebook_errors.description: Id. can only be used in same footnote or immediately following footnote
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example:
See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999).1

2. Williams v. Board.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999).1 Id.

bluebook_errors.description: Id. always refers to identical source, not just same general work
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456, 460 (1999). Id. at 465 (citing different case).
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456, 460 (1999). Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456, 465 (1999).

bluebook_errors.description: Id. must always be capitalized
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999). id.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See Smith v. Jones, 123 F.3d 456 (1999). Id.

bluebook_errors.description: Supra should provide sufficient information to identify authority
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See Smith, Constitutional Law Treatise, supra, at 456.

bluebook_errors.description: Supra must include author last name or short title to avoid confusion
Hereinafter must appear inside parenthetical after full citation
Hereinafter abbreviation must be in quotation marks
Hereinafter should only be used for secondary sources or cumbersome names
Hereinafter is used when multiple works by same author are cited
bluebook_errors.regex_validate: Check context for multiple works by author
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: See John Smith, The Law of Contracts (2020) (hereinafter "Smith").
bluebook_errors.correct_example: See John Smith, The Law of Contracts (2020) [and later: Smith, The Law of Torts (2021)]. Use hereinafter only if citing multiple.

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Block Quote Threshold - 50+ Words Not Block Formatted
bluebook_errors.description: Quotation containing 50 or more words must be formatted as block quote (indented, no outer quotation marks)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "This is a very long quotation that contains more than fifty words and should therefore be formatted as a block quotation according to Bluebook Rule 5.1, but it has been incorrectly formatted as an inline quotation with quotation marks around it."
bluebook_errors.correct_example: This is a very long quotation that contains more than fifty words and should therefore be formatted as a block quotation according to Bluebook Rule 5.1, and it has been correctly formatted without quotation marks.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Count the exact number of words in this quotation. If 50+ words, it must be block quoted (indented, no outer quotes). Return: {word_count, is_compliant, required_format}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Remove quotation marks, indent entire passage, preserve internal quotes

bluebook_errors.description: Quotation under 50 words incorrectly formatted as block quote
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: This short quote is only twelve words long.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: "This short quote is only twelve words long."
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Count words in this potential block quote. If under 50 words, should be inline with quotes. Return: {word_count, should_be_inline, correction}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Remove indentation, add quotation marks

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Block Quote With Outer Quotation Marks
bluebook_errors.description: Block quotation incorrectly includes outer quotation marks
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "This is a block quote that should not have outer quotation marks."
bluebook_errors.correct_example: This is a block quote that correctly has no outer quotation marks.
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Remove outer quotation marks from block quote while preserving internal quotes

bluebook_errors.description: Block quotation not indented properly (should be 4-8 spaces or 1 tab)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use consistent 4-space or 1-tab indentation for block quotes

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Internal Quotes Not Preserved in Block Quote
bluebook_errors.description: Block quotation fails to preserve internal quotation marks from original source
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The court stated that the defendant was negligent.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court stated that "the defendant was negligent."
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Compare this block quote to the original. Are internal quotation marks from the source properly preserved? Return: {has_internal_quotes, properly_preserved, missing_quotes: []}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Preserve all internal quotation marks from original source

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Block Quote Not Separated by Blank Lines
bluebook_errors.description: Block quotation not properly separated from surrounding text with blank lines
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example:
The court held:
    This is the block quote.
Then the court continued.
bluebook_errors.correct_example:
The court held:

    This is the block quote.

Then the court continued.
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add blank line before and after block quotations

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Block Quote Missing Line Break After Introduction
bluebook_errors.description: Block quote not preceded by line break after introducing text
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example:
The court held:
    This is a block quote.
bluebook_errors.correct_example:
The court held:

    This is a block quote.
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Ensure blank line before block quote

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Block Quote Line Length Exceeds Margin
bluebook_errors.description: Block quote lines exceed standard margins
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: This is a very long line in a block quote that exceeds the standard margin width and should be wrapped appropriately.
bluebook_errors.correct_example:
This is a block quote line that
    is properly wrapped to fit within
    standard margins.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if block quote lines exceed 80 characters. Return: {line_lengths, needs_wrapping}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Wrap block quote to fit within margins

bluebook_errors.description: Alteration to quoted text not indicated with brackets
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Compare this quote to the original. Are all alterations (added/changed words) properly bracketed? Return: {has_alterations, all_bracketed, unbracketed_alterations: []}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Enclose all alterations to quoted text in brackets

bluebook_errors.description: Error in original quotation not marked with [sic]
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Identify errors in this quotation (spelling, grammar). If errors are preserved from original, they need [sic]. Return: {errors_found: [], sic_needed, sic_present}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add [sic] immediately after preserved errors from original

bluebook_errors.description: [sic] incorrectly capitalized (should be lowercase)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Change to lowercase: [sic]

bluebook_errors.description: sic used without brackets
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Place sic in brackets: [sic]

bluebook_errors.description: [sic] should not be italicized when in brackets
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Remove italics from [sic]

bluebook_errors.description: Changed capitalization not indicated with brackets
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "the Court held..." (when original was "The Court held...")
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Compare capitalization in this quote to original. Are capitalization changes properly bracketed? Return: {has_cap_changes, all_bracketed, issues: []}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Bracket any changed capital letter: [T]he or [c]ourt

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Incorrect Nested Quote Marks - Double in Double
bluebook_errors.description: Nested quotation uses double quotes within double quotes (should alternate)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Alternate quotation marks: outer double, inner single

bluebook_errors.description: Triple-nested quotations not properly alternated (double > single > double)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "The article stated 'The witness said 'I saw it' clearly' in testimony."
bluebook_errors.correct_example: "The article stated 'The witness said "I saw it" clearly' in testimony."
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Analyze nesting level of quotes. Proper alternation: outermost double, 2nd level single, 3rd level double. Return: {nesting_levels, correct_alternation, should_be}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Alternate: double > single > double > single...

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Single Quote as Outer Quote in American Style
bluebook_errors.description: Single quotation mark used as outer quote (American style uses double)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use double quotes for outer quotations in American style

bluebook_errors.description: Addition to quote in brackets could be confused with original text
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "The defendant [who was driving recklessly] was negligent."
bluebook_errors.correct_example: "The defendant [who was driving recklessly--author's addition] was negligent."
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Identify bracketed additions. Are substantial additions clearly marked as not from original? Return: {bracketed_additions: [], clarity_issues: []}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: For substantial bracketed additions, consider marking clearly or using explanatory parenthetical

bluebook_errors.description: Emphasis (italics/bold) added to quote not indicated
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if this quote contains emphasis (italics/bold). If added by author (not in original), must be noted. Return: {has_emphasis, emphasis_indicated, needs_notation}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add parenthetical: (emphasis added) or (emphasis in original)

bluebook_errors.description: Quotation within quotation not properly using single quotes
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "The court stated 'this is wrong'" should use single quotes.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court stated 'this is correct' in its opinion.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Identify quoted text within quotes. Verify single quotes are used for inner quotes. Return: {nested_quotes, use_single_quotes}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use single quotes for text quoted within a quotation

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Quotation Within Block Quote Not Properly Formatted
bluebook_errors.description: Direct quotation within a block quote lacks proper quote marks
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The court said the defendant was negligent.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court said "the defendant was negligent."
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if quoted speech in block quotes has proper quotation marks. Return: {has_quotation_marks, needs_quotes}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add quotation marks around directly quoted speech

bluebook_errors.description: Omitted material within quotation not indicated with ellipsis
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "The defendant was negligent and caused harm." (middle phrase omitted)
bluebook_errors.correct_example: "The defendant was negligent ... and caused harm."
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Compare this quote to original. Are all omissions properly marked with ellipsis? Return: {has_omissions, all_marked, unmarked_omissions: []}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add ellipsis (...) to indicate omitted material

bluebook_errors.description: Quote incorrectly begins with ellipsis when starting mid-sentence
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "... the court held that negligence was proven."
bluebook_errors.correct_example: "[T]he court held that negligence was proven."
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Remove initial ellipsis; use lowercase or bracketed capital

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Ellipsis Wrong Number of Dots - Two Dots
bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis has only two periods (should be three)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use exactly three periods: ...

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Ellipsis Wrong Number of Dots - Five or More
bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis has five or more periods (should be three or four)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use three periods for omission, or four if sentence ends

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Ellipsis Spacing Incorrect - No Space Before
bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis lacks proper spacing (should have space before and after)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add space before ellipsis

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Ellipsis Spacing Incorrect - No Space After
bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis lacks proper spacing after
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add space after ellipsis

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Sentence-Ending Ellipsis Should Be Four Dots
bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis at end of sentence should be four dots (period + ellipsis) when sentence ends
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if this ellipsis ends a sentence. If original sentence ended here, use four dots (. ...). Return: {sentence_ends, should_be_four_dots}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use four dots when omission occurs at end of sentence that ends in original

bluebook_errors.description: Four-dot ellipsis used mid-sentence (should be three)
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use three dots for mid-sentence omissions

bluebook_errors.description: Omission fundamentally alters the meaning of the quotation
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: "The court held ... the defendant liable." (when original said "not liable")
bluebook_errors.correct_example: Use complete relevant portion without misleading omission
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Compare quote with omissions to original. Does the omission alter or misrepresent the fundamental meaning? Return: {meaning_preserved, misrepresentation_risk, explanation}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Do not omit material that changes fundamental meaning; use paraphrase instead

bluebook_errors.description: Omission of entire paragraph(s) not properly indicated with paragraph-break ellipsis
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Block quote continues without showing paragraph was skipped
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if full paragraphs are omitted from this block quote. Paragraph omissions need centered ellipsis line. Return: {paragraph_breaks_omitted, properly_indicated}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use centered line of spaced periods (. . . .) to indicate paragraph omission

bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis has incorrect spacing (should be three periods with spaces)
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court found . . . that negligence occurred.
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use ' . . . ' for ellipsis with proper spacing

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Ellipsis at Sentence End Not Followed by Period
bluebook_errors.description: Ellipsis indicating omission at end needs period for sentence termination
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The court stated that . . . the defendant was guilty
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court stated that . . . the defendant was guilty.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if sentence ending with ellipsis has proper termination period. Return: {needs_period, sentence_complete}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add period after ellipsis at end of sentence

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Omission Not Indicated at Paragraph Break
bluebook_errors.description: Omission of entire paragraph not indicated with ellipsis
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example:
First paragraph of quote.

    Third paragraph without omission indicator.
bluebook_errors.correct_example:
First paragraph of quote.

    . . .

    Third paragraph.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if paragraph breaks in quotations show omitted paragraphs with ellipsis. Return: {paragraph_breaks, has_omission_indicator}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add ellipsis to indicate omitted paragraphs

bluebook_errors.description: Corporation abbreviated in textual sentence (should be spelled out)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The Corp. was negligent in its operations.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The Corporation was negligent in its operations.
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Spell out abbreviations in textual sentences; use only in citations

bluebook_errors.description: Incorporated abbreviated in textual sentence
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Spell out Inc. in text

bluebook_errors.description: Company abbreviated in textual sentence
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Spell out Co. in text

bluebook_errors.description: Limited abbreviated in textual sentence
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Spell out Ltd. in text

bluebook_errors.description: Department abbreviated in textual sentence
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Spell out Dept. in text

bluebook_errors.description: Association abbreviated in textual sentence
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Spell out Assoc./Ass'n in text

bluebook_errors.description: Word not abbreviated in citation when standard Bluebook abbreviation exists
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Analyze this citation. Check each word against Bluebook abbreviation tables (T6, T7, T8, T10). Return: {words_requiring_abbreviation: [{word, correct_abbrev, table}]}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use standard Bluebook abbreviations in citations per Tables T6, T7, T8, T10

bluebook_errors.description: Abbreviation used doesn't match Bluebook-approved form
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones Co, 123 F.3d 456 (missing period)
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Compare this abbreviation to Bluebook tables. Is it the exact standard form (capitalization, periods, spacing)? Return: {abbreviation, is_standard, correct_form, table_reference}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use exact Bluebook abbreviation form from tables

bluebook_errors.description: Same term abbreviated inconsistently
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Corporation in one citation, Corp. in another for same entity
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Scan document for all uses of this term. Check if abbreviated consistently in all citations. Return: {term, citation_uses: [{location, form}], is_consistent}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use consistent abbreviation form throughout document

bluebook_errors.description: State abbreviation doesn't match Table T10
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: CA instead of Cal. or California instead of Cal. in citation
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check if this state abbreviation matches Table T10 standard. Return: {state, abbreviation_used, t10_standard, is_correct}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use Table T10 abbreviations for states in citations

bluebook_errors.description: Court name not properly abbreviated
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: S.D. New York instead of S.D.N.Y.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Verify this court abbreviation against Bluebook standards (Table T1, T10). Return: {court, abbreviation_used, correct_form}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use standard Bluebook court abbreviations

bluebook_errors.description: Widely known acronym spelled out when abbreviation is preferred
bluebook_errors.regex_detect: \b(Federal Bureau of Investigation|Central Intelligence Agency|National Labor Relations Board|Securities and Exchange Commission|Environmental Protection Agency)\b
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The Federal Bureau of Investigation investigated...
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use acronym for widely known organizations (FBI, CIA, NLRB, SEC, EPA, etc.)

bluebook_errors.description: Ampersand (&) used in text instead of 'and' (should only be in citations for case names)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The plaintiff & defendant reached a settlement.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The plaintiff and defendant reached a settlement.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check context: is this in citation or text? Use & only in case names/citations, spell 'and' in text. Return: {is_citation, ampersand_appropriate}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use 'and' in text; use & only in citations/case names

bluebook_errors.description: Periodical title not abbreviated per Table T10
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Harvard Law Review instead of HARV. L. REV.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check this periodical abbreviation against Table T10. Return: {periodical, abbreviation_used, t10_standard, is_correct}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use Table T10 abbreviations for periodicals

bluebook_errors.rule_title: State Abbreviation Not Used in Citation
bluebook_errors.description: State name spelled out instead of using standard abbreviation in citation
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Replace state name with standard abbreviation

bluebook_errors.description: Abbreviation missing periods between letters
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Add periods to abbreviations

bluebook_errors.description: Same term abbreviated inconsistently throughout document
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: First use: Restatement (Second) of Contracts § 1. Later use: Rest. 2d Contracts § 1.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: Consistent use: Restatement (Second) of Contracts § 1 throughout.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Find all abbreviations in document and check consistency. Return: {abbreviation_term, all_variants, consistent}
bluebook_errors.fix_instructions: Use consistent abbreviation form throughout document

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Number 0-99 Not Spelled Out in Text
bluebook_errors.description: Number zero through ninety-nine written as numeral in text
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The court considered 45 factors in its decision.
bluebook_errors.correct_example: The court considered forty-five factors in its decision.
bluebook_errors.gpt_prompt: Check context: is this number in text or citation? In text, spell out 0-99. Exceptions: dates, citations, stats. Return: {number, is_text, should_spell_out, exceptions_apply}

bluebook_errors.description: Citation begins with reporter number without case name
Citation missing reporter abbreviation between volume and page numbers
Reporter abbreviation followed directly by year without page numbers
Citation ends with page number without year in parentheses
Case name should be italicized in academic writing (underscored or starred)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: According to Roe v. Wade, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

bluebook_errors.description: Reporter abbreviation has incorrect format or capitalization
Volume number contains excessive digits or incorrect formatting
If citing multiple reporters, abbreviations should be consistent
Pin-cite should be separated from first page
Page numbers should use proper range format
Case name includes first names or initials (should be last names only)
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: John Doe v. Jane Smith, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

bluebook_errors.description: Middle names or initials included when they should be omitted
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: John Michael Doe v. Jane Sarah Smith, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

bluebook_errors.description: Case name starts with 'The' which should be omitted
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: The United States v. Nixon, 418 U.S. 683 (1974)

bluebook_errors.description: Multiple parties on same side should be abbreviated to first party only
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith and Jones v. Brown, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

bluebook_errors.description: Alternative names like AKA or d/b/a should be omitted
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones AKA Brown, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

bluebook_errors.description: State or country names in party names should be abbreviated per Table T10
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith v. State of California, 410 U.S. 113 (1973)

bluebook_errors.description: Entity names should be abbreviated per Table T6 (Co., Inc., etc.)
In re or Ex parte should be properly formatted without omitting space
Case name should use 'v.' not 'versus'
Ampersand should be written as & per T6 only in specific contexts, not as first word substitute
Entity names should be complete
Et al. should not appear in case name
First and last names should be reduced to last name only
The as first word of case name should always be omitted
NLRB and similar widely known acronyms should be used
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: National Labor Relations Board v. Jones

bluebook_errors.description: Corporation should be abbreviated to Corp. per T6
Entity designation words should be abbreviated per T6
Use proper abbreviations per T6
Ampersand usage needs T6 verification

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Additional Rules for Case Names in Citations
bluebook_errors.description: Only first party on each side of v. should be cited
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, Brown, and Davis

bluebook_errors.description: Ex rel. should be properly formatted and spaced
bluebook_errors.correct_example: Smith ex rel. Brown v. Jones

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Additional Rules for Case Names in Citations
bluebook_errors.description: Geographic units in party names should be abbreviated per T10

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Additional Rules for Case Names in Citations
bluebook_errors.description: Case name order should reflect appellant v. appellee or original case order
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Jones v. Smith (when Smith should be first)

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Additional Rules for Case Names in Citations
bluebook_errors.description: Ex rel. needs proper spacing
Reporter abbreviation should follow official Bluebook designations
Second, third series should be indicated (2d, 3d) when applicable
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 N.E. 113 (should be N.E.2d)

bluebook_errors.description: Verify series designation matches actual reporter publication
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones, 400 S.E.2d 113 (when should be 3d)

bluebook_errors.description: Official reporters (like U.S.) should be cited when available
bluebook_errors.incorrect_example: 410 S. Ct. 113 (should cite to U.S. if available)

bluebook_errors.description: Verify series designation accuracy
Regional reporters may need court designation

bluebook_errors.description: Parallel citations to state reporter should be included when available

bluebook_errors.description: Official reporter should come first in parallel citations

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Parallel Citations and Which Source(s) to Cite
bluebook_errors.description: Citation order should reflect precedence (official before unofficial)

bluebook_errors.rule_title: Parallel Citations and Which Source(s) to Cite
bluebook_errors.description: Some cases require all major reporter parallel citations
Federal reporters should use F., F.2d, F.3d not Fed.
Supreme Court Reporter should be abbreviated S. Ct.
Regional reporters need designation (N.E., S.E., etc.)
Federal Appendix should be cited as F. App'x not F.A.
Reporter series should be properly designated
Public domain citation must include court designation
Public domain citation should use full year format
Public domain should include paragraph numbers when needed
Non-obvious reporters need court abbreviation in parentheses
Obvious reporters (like U.S.) do not need court designation
Court names should be abbreviated per Table T1

Include court in subsequent history citation
History should be chronological
